name: Dataset
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset
description:
Dataset

Dataset is the data saved in a project’s Datastore. Dataset is analogous to a database in relational database world.

Gcloud::Datastore::Dataset is the main object for interacting with Google Datastore. Gcloud::Datastore::Entity objects are created, read, updated, and deleted by Gcloud::Datastore::Dataset.

See Gcloud#datastore

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dataset = gcloud.datastore

query = dataset.query("Task").
  where("completed", "=", true)

tasks = dataset.run query

require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new "my-todo-project",
                    "/path/to/keyfile.json"

dataset = gcloud.datastore
dataset.project #=> "my-todo-project"

methods.name: allocate_ids
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset#allocate_ids
methods.description: Generate IDs for a Key before creating an entity.

examples.code:
empty_key = dataset.key "Task"
task_keys = dataset.allocate_ids empty_key, 5

params.name: incomplete_key
params.description: A Key without id or name set.

params.name: count
params.description: The number of new key IDs to create.

methods.name: save
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset#save
methods.description: Persist one or more entities to the Datastore.

examples.code: dataset.save task1, task2

params.name: entities
params.description: One or more entity objects to be saved without id or name set.

methods.name: find
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset#find
methods.description: Retrieve an entity by providing key information.

examples.caption: Finding an entity with a key:
examples.code:
key = dataset.key "Task", 123456
task = dataset.find key

examples.caption: Finding an entity with a kind and id/name:
examples.code: task = dataset.find "Task", 123456

params.name: key_or_kind
params.description: A Key object or kind string value.

params.name: id_or_name
params.description: The Key’s id or name value if a kind was provided in the first parameter.

methods.name: find_all
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset#find_all
methods.description: Retrieve the entities for the provided keys.

examples.code:
gcloud = Gcloud.new
dataset = gcloud.datastore
key1 = dataset.key "Task", 123456
key2 = dataset.key "Task", 987654
tasks = dataset.find_all key1, key2

params.name: keys
params.description: One or more Key objects to find records for.

examples.code:
gcloud = Gcloud.new
dataset = gcloud.datastore
dataset.delete entity1, entity2

params.name: entities_or_keys
params.description:
One or more Entity or Key objects
to remove.

examples.code:
query = dataset.query("Task").
  where("completed", "=", true)
tasks = dataset.run query

examples.caption: Run the query within a namespace with the namespace option:
examples.code:
query = Gcloud::Datastore::Query.new.kind("Task").
  where("completed", "=", true)
tasks = dataset.run query, namespace: "ns~todo-project"

params.name: query
params.description: The Query object with the search criteria.

params.name: namespace
params.description: The namespace the query is to run within.

examples.caption: Runs the given block in a database transaction:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dataset = gcloud.datastore

user = dataset.entity "User", "heidi" do |u|
  u["name"] = "Heidi Henderson"
  u["email"] = "heidi@example.net"
end

dataset.transaction do |tx|
  if tx.find(user.key).nil?
    tx.save user
  end
end

examples.caption: If no block is given, a Transaction object is returned:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dataset = gcloud.datastore

user = dataset.entity "User", "heidi" do |u|
  u["name"] = "Heidi Henderson"
  u["email"] = "heidi@example.net"
end

tx = dataset.transaction
begin
  if tx.find(user.key).nil?
    tx.save user
  end
  tx.commit
rescue
  tx.rollback
end

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a new transaction

methods.name: query
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset#query
methods.description: Create a new Query instance. This is a convenience method to make the creation of Query objects easier.

examples.code:
query = dataset.query("Task").
  where("completed", "=", true)
tasks = dataset.run query

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
query = Gcloud::Datastore::Query.new.
  kind("Task").
  where("completed", "=", true)
tasks = dataset.run query

params.name: kinds
params.description: The kind of entities to query. This is optional.

methods.name: key
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset#key
methods.description: Create a new Key instance. This is a convenience method to make the creation of Key objects easier.

examples.code: key = dataset.key "User", "heidi@example.com"

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code: key = Gcloud::Datastore::Key.new "User", "heidi@example.com"

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind of the Key. This is optional.

params.name: id_or_name
params.description:
The id or name of the Key. This is
optional.

methods.name: entity
title: Gcloud
Datastore
Dataset#entity
methods.description:
Create a new empty Entity instance. This is a convenience method to make the creation of Entity objects easier.

end

examples.code: entity = dataset.entity

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code: entity = Gcloud::Datastore::Entity.new

examples.caption: The key can also be passed in as an object:
examples.code:
key = dataset.key "User", "heidi@example.com"
entity = dataset.entity key

examples.caption: Or the key values can be passed in as parameters:
examples.code: entity = dataset.entity "User", "heidi@example.com"

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
key = Gcloud::Datastore::Key.new "User", "heidi@example.com"
entity = Gcloud::Datastore::Entity.new
entity.key = key

examples.caption: The newly created entity can also be configured using a block:
examples.code:
user = dataset.entity "User", "heidi@example.com" do |u|
  u["name"] = "Heidi Henderson"

examples.caption: The previous example is equivalent to:
examples.code:
key = Gcloud::Datastore::Key.new "User", "heidi@example.com"
entity = Gcloud::Datastore::Entity.new
entity.key = key
entity["name"] = "Heidi Henderson"

params.name: key_or_kind
params.description: A Key object or kind string value. This is optional.

params.name: id_or_name
params.description: The Key’s id or name value if a kind was provided in the first parameter.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a new entity
